snippet: A prosecution witness in the coming trial of Mostafa Kamel Mostafa, a cleric accused of aiding Al Qaeda, is reluctant to come to New York from Britain.
abstract: Saakid Badat, prosecution witness in Manhattan terrorism trial of Mostafa Kamel Mostafa, cleric accused of aiding Al Qaeda, is reluctant to come to New York from Britain because he is still under indictment in the United States for a plot in 2001 to blow up airliners with bombs hidden in shoes; Judge Katherine B Forrest sets a deadline of six days for Badat to give a final answer.
lead_paragraph: A prosecution witness in the coming trial of Mostafa Kamel Mostafa, a cleric accused of aiding Al Qaeda, is reluctant to come to New York from Britain.
